10 void PosePublisher::init() {
11  // Here just starting the function which will initialize the callback from different IMU placed on Franka
12  filter_.setWorldFrame(WorldFrame::ENU);
13  get_imu_data();
14 
15 }

17 void PosePublisher::get_imu_data() {
18  // Loop through IMU numbers and subscribe to them with static class function imu_callback
19  std::vector<int> imu_numbers {0};
20 // for(int i: imu_numbers){
21 // ros::Subscriber cam_sub = nh->subscribe("imu_data"+std::to_string(i),100, PosePublisher::imu_callback);
22 // }
23  ros::Subscriber cam_sub = nh->subscribe(original_imu_publisher_name, 100, PosePublisher::imu_callback);
24  ros::spin();
25 }
26 
27 void PosePublisher::imu_callback(const sensor_msgs::Imu::ConstPtr &msg) {
28  double q0, q1, q2, q3;
29  const geometry_msgs::Vector3& ang_vel = msg->angular_velocity;
30  const geometry_msgs::Vector3& lin_acc = msg->linear_acceleration;
31  /*
32  * AHRS Stuff goes below
33  *
34  */
35  ros::Time time = msg->header.stamp;
36  std::string imu_frame_ = msg->header.frame_id;
37  if (!initialized || stateless){
38  geometry_msgs::Quaternion init_q;
39  StatelessOrientation::computeOrientation(WorldFrame::ENU, lin_acc, init_q);
40  filter_.setOrientation(init_q.w, init_q.x, init_q.y, init_q.z);
41  }
42  if(!initialized){
43  last_time = time;
44  initialized = true;
45  }
46  double dt;
47  dt = (time - last_time).toSec();
48  filter_.madgwickAHRSupdateIMU(
49  ang_vel.x, ang_vel.y, ang_vel.z,
50  lin_acc.x, lin_acc.y, lin_acc.z,
51  dt);
52  last_time = time;
53  filter_.getOrientation(q0,q1,q2,q3);
54  // AHRS Stuff end
55  geometry_msgs::Quaternion calculated_quaternion;
56  /*Why considering like that?:
57  * Proof: https://github.com/ccny-ros-pkg/imu_tools/blob/indigo/imu_filter_madgwick/src/imu_filter_ros.cpp#L297
58  * */
59  calculated_quaternion.x = q1;
60  calculated_quaternion.y = q2;
61  calculated_quaternion.z = q3;
62  calculated_quaternion.w = q0;
63  /*
64  * Writing like this has two reasons
65  * 1) You cannot re initialize imu0_pose and publish to it, when done in a loop nothing gets published and also
66  * the topic isn't visible. Basically you can't initialize like this PosePublisher::nh->advertise<geometry_msgs::Quaternion>("imu0_pose", 100) again and again and publish to it
67  * Hence the reason of hardcoding
68  *
69  * 2) This will make it fast rather than initializing again and again
70  *
71  * 3) Using if-else if will make it easier to read rather than switch
72  * */
73  imu_pose.publish(calculated_quaternion);
74 // std::cout << calculated_quaternion.x << "," << calculated_quaternion.y << "," << calculated_quaternion.z << "," << calculated_quaternion.w << std::endl;
75 
76 }
